schema.name: Name of the location. Should be generic and not an actual proper name.
schema.description: Description of what the location is, as well as the dangers and opportunities it presents.
schema.category: What type of location it is.
schema.atmosphere: A short and punchy description of the atmosphere of the location that doesn't repeat details from the "description" field. Should be evocative and not too long. This should try to include 1. What sounds can be heard? 2. What scents can be smelled? 3. What visual activity is happening? 4. What objects and clutter are lying around or visible that are unique to this place? 5. What small visual details are noticed that are unique to this place? 6. What does a person physically feel while in this space that is distinct from other places, like heat, cold, dampness, etc?

categories.name: ruin
categories.description: abandoned places where sapient beings once lived or worked

categories.name: settlement
categories.description: a place where sapient beings live

categories.name: sacred_site
categories.description: a place where sapient beings worship a deity

categories.name: magical_site
categories.description: a place where magic is present and affects the world around it

categories.name: geography
categories.description: a place that is a part of the natural world, without specific magical or supernatural elements

categories.name: dungeon
categories.description: an extensive network of tunnels and chambers, often with traps and puzzles, that is used for storage, torture, or other purposes

categories.name: planar
categories.description: a portal or crossing between planes of existence
